result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey John Russell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF374, 14CF466 and 15CF174:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared. Case called at 9:52 a.m. ADA McKinley states there is a joint recommendation. Recites agreement. Atty Schwab in agreement. Will waive any preliminary hearing not held in any of the files. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1  OWI 5th in 14CF374. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 OWI 5th in 14CF374. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct. 2 in 14CF374. Court dismisses and reads in 14CF466 and 15CF174. Sentencing arguments. Defendant gives statement. Crt orders:

I/S a bifercated sentence of 6 years total confinement
      - 3 years initial confinement, 3 years ES

- S/W 3 years probation

Conditions of probation:
- 1 year county jail. If becomes employed, court will grant Huber. 32 days jail credit subject to objection from the DA's Office. State has 10 days to file an objection on jail credit.

- If the stay is lifted, defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

- Fine in the amount of $1,284.00. Bond on file to apply to fine. To be paid over the course of probation

- DNA Sample and Surcharge

- Blood draw fee in the amount of $85.50 to be paid to New Richmond Police Department

- Drivers license revoked for a period of 24 months

- IID for a period of 24 months

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

ADA Collins updates the court and requests to set it for trial. Atty. Schwab agrees. Atty.'s to see JA for scheduling. FPT  to be scheduled 2 weeks prior to JT.

Attorney Caton has filed letter with the court stating the DE is in a chemical dependency treatment program.  Continue PTC.  Court adjourned at 11;12 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 09:30 am.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.  

Attorney Caton is to advise the court if the DE is a treatment facility.  If not in a treatment facility then the DE is to report every Monday and Thursday before 4:30 pm to the New Richmond Police Department for PBT.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:24 a.m. ADA Gehler makes statement.  Subpoena was sent late and state unable to serve to serve the officer.  Attorney Caton makes a motion to dismiss.  ADA Gehler is asking court for 72 hours to refile.  Attorney Caton is asking to be heard on bond and is asking amend to a signature bond.  The state objects and asks the bond remain.
